alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 8:03AM AKST until December 13 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. East winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Along the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 6 PM AKST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Visibilities reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Arctic air temperatures combined with the wind will cause wind chills to be as low as 35 degrees below zero which could cause frostbite in as little as 10 to 15 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
